job_description: Join Verkada in this exciting opportunity.

About Akuna: Akuna Capital is an innovative trading firm with a strong focus on collaboration, cutting-edge technology, data-driven solutions and automation. We specialize in providing liquidity as an options market-maker ‚Äì meaning we are committed to providing competitive quotes that we are willing to both buy and sell. To do this successfully, we design and implement our own low latency technologies, trading strategies and mathematical models. Our Founding Partners first conceptualized Akuna in their hometown of Sydney. They opened the firm‚Äôs first office in 2011 in the heart of the derivatives industry and the options capital of the world ‚Äì Chicago. Today, Akuna is proud to operate from additional offices in Sydney, Shanghai, Singapore, and London. What you‚Äôll do as an Entry-Level Software Engineer on the C++ Team at Akuna: Software Engineers at Akuna have the opportunity to use cutting-edge technology while working on high performance/low latency systems. We offer a team-based approach to trading and software engineering, believing that productive integration of the two groups is vital for success in this industry. Akuna loves Software Engineers who are self-starters and have the ability to problem solve and think outside of the box. We value innovation and hard work, and we want you to make an impact at the firm. Whether you are interested in trading infrastructure, algorithms, exchange gateways, performance engineering, hardware or data capture and analysis, or something else, there‚Äôs engaging work to be done. If you are excited to jump in and make a difference, Akuna could be the place for you. The C++ teams work on applications where C++ is used for computational heavy-lifting and for applications that have critical, low-latency processes such as trading strategies. C++ provides the flexibility and low-level control that our Software Engineers need to get maximum performance out of multi-core, super-scalar processors. No previous experience in finance or trading is required. Training and continuous education is provided for all Engineers to ensure they have the skills and knowledge needed to be successful. Qualities that make great candidates: BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics or related field completed upon employment Experience programming in modern C++ Experience with several of the following ‚Äì distributed systems, parallel processing, networking, data structures and algorithms and operating systems Strong analytic and problem-solving skills Exposure to scripting and rudimentary data mining and regression analysis, ideally in Python with Pandas and Numpy Ability to communicate with the trading team, obtain requirements, find solutions and implement them in a clean and concise way The ability to react quickly and accurately to rapidly changing market conditions, including the ability to quickly and accurately respond to novel and unexpected problems Passion for innovation and building systems from the ground up Ability to adapt to an ever-changing environment Self-starter attitude with the ability to work independently Strong sense of ownership Must be graduating August 2026 or prior GPA of 3.5 or above Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required on the first day of employment including F-1 students using OPT or STEM **Resumes must be submitted in PDF format. In addition to technical skillsets, Akuna values the unique perspectives people can bring to the table to collaboratively solve complex problems and drive Akuna forward. We want everyone to feel empowered to apply. We welcome your application and encourage you to take the first steps toward your future with us! Please note: By submitting an application to this role, you are indicating this is your top preference and acknowledge you will not be considered for other Quant and/or Tech roles at Akuna this recruiting season. This acknowledgement does not limit applications to Trading roles ‚Äì in addition to this role, you may apply to any Trader roles of interest. In accordance with Illinois Equal Pay Act, the minimum base salary starts at $130,000. Exact compensation offered may vary based on many factors including, but not limited to, the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and skill set. This role is also eligible for a discretionary performance bonus as part of the total compensation package and includes a comprehensive benefits package that may encompass employer-paid medical, dental, vision, retirement contributions, paid time off, and other benefits. The minimum base salary herein was determined in good faith by Akuna Capital LLC.

About Decagon Decagon is the leading conversational AI platform empowering every brand to deliver concierge customer experience. Our AI agents provide intelligent, human-like responses across chat, email, and voice, resolving millions of customer inquiries across every language and at any time. Since coming out of stealth, Decagon has experienced rapid growth. We partner with industry leaders like Hertz, Eventbrite, Duolingo, Oura, Bilt, Curology, and Samsara to redefine customer experience at scale. We've raised over $200M from Bain Capital Ventures, Accel, a16z, BOND Capital, A*, Elad Gil, and notable angels such as the founders of Box, Airtable, Rippling, Okta, Lattice, and Klaviyo. We‚Äôre an in-office company, driven by a shared commitment to excellence and velocity. Our values‚Äî customers are everything , relentless momentum , winner‚Äôs mindset , and stronger together ‚Äîshape how we work and grow as a team. About the Team The Agent Engineering team at Decagon deploys mission-critical AI agents to our customers that impact millions of users and directly drive Decagon‚Äôs growth. You will build on our industry-leading AI agent platform, collaborate directly with customers and use your own creativity to devise long-term, scalable solutions. Our mission is to deliver magical support experiences ‚Äî AI agents working alongside human agents to help users resolve their issues. About the Role On the Agent Engineering team, you‚Äôll have complete ownership and autonomy in building and shipping best-in-class AI agents, from initial implementation through continuous iteration. You‚Äôll work directly with leaders across industries like finance, healthcare, and hospitality, solving their users‚Äô needs with reliable and intuitive AI agents. Engineers here own their work end-to-end and are trusted to make a real impact. This role is for someone who dives deep into complex system challenges and builds elegant solutions that scale to millions of users. This role is designed for candidates graduating between December 2025‚ÄìJuly 2026. We are an in-person company based in San Francisco and New York. In this role, you will Design and build AI agents that outperform human agents in managing complex customer interactions and driving customer retention Identify cross-customer trends that guide the evolution of Decagon‚Äôs agent building platform and research efforts Experiment with and run evaluations on the latest text and voice models, then integrate them at scale with large enterprise-grade customers Your background looks something like this Pursuing or completing a B.S. (or higher) in Computer Science or a related technical field Proficiency with Python, Typescript, and asynchronous programming Track record of building and shipping high-quality products and features through coursework, internships, or personal projects Excitement to thrive in a fast-paced environment, continuously learn, and sharpen your skills Even better Prior experience working with multi-modal models Benefits Medical, dental, and vision benefits Take what you need vacation policy Daily lunches, dinners, and snacks in the office to keep you at your best Compensation $180K + Offers Equity

Junior Data Analyst Wilmington, DE *Hybrid Work Model (Must work 3 days/week onsite in Wilmington) Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm ET Role Overview: We‚Äôre looking for a curious and detail-oriented Junior Data Analyst to join our Product Management team. In this role, you‚Äôll support data-driven decision-making by analyzing business and product data, uncover insights, and help shape strategies that improve customer experience and drive growth. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with product managers and project management ensuring internal goals and being tracked and met. Key Responsibilities: - Assist in gathering and interpreting data to support product decisions and business strategies. - Create and maintain dashboards and reports that track key performance indicators (KPIs) across products and customer segments. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and translate them into actionable reporting solutions. - Support product managers in ident...

About Spearbit & Cantina: Founded in 2021 by former Ethereum Foundation Solidity engineers, Spearbit tackles Web3 security challenges. Our founding team built the leading blockchain language and secured the largest smart contract, protecting over $160B in value. We're building Cantina , the "GitHub for Security", connecting security researchers with projects needing expertise. Our Cantina security platform has powered major competitions and serves the leading projects in Web 3. It currently supports collaborative security reviews, public and private security competitions, bug bounty programs, incident response, and AI code analyzer. The Opportunity: We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to drive our efforts in leveraging advanced Large Language Models (LLMs) within Cantina Code. You will play a key role in building intelligent features that enhance code security and collaboration on our platform. We are open to a variety of experience levels including recent graduates. What you'll do: Design, prototype, and productionise multi‚Äêagent pipelines (e.g., LangGraph / CrewAI‚Äêstyle graphs) that collaborate to scan Solidity smart‚Äêcontract repositories. Build and fine‚Äêtune bespoke LLMs and smaller custom models for code understanding (AST‚Äêaware transformers, graph‚Äêneural nets, etc.). Encode and maintain agentic knowledge ‚Äî task memories, tool use policies, and shared world‚Äêmodels ‚Äî so agents improve autonomously. Implement concept‚Äêdrift & data‚Äêdrift monitors that retrain or hot‚Äêswap models when blockchain languages or attacker tactics evolve. Expose capabilities through FastAPI micro‚Äêservices and deploy them on AWS. Collaborate with security researchers to turn novel attack patterns into detection heuristics and learning signals. Deploy and manage machine learning models and services on AWS. Collaborate closely with product managers, data scientists, and engineers to integrate AI solutions seamlessly. What we‚Äôre looking for: Experience with Python and building ML systems in production. Practical experience fine‚Äêtuning LLMs (LoRA, QLoRA, DPO/RLHF). Familiarity with agentic / autonomous‚ÄêAI frameworks (LangGraph) and their evaluation challenges. Solid grounding in software‚Äê2‚Äêsoftware architectures: REST contracts, event‚Äêdriven workflows, distributed tracing. Comfort learning/reading Solidity and reasoning about smart‚Äêcontract security primitives. Benefits Competitive salary and performance-based compensation opportunities Opportunity to work in an early-stage startup with a talented and passionate team. Exposure to high-profile clients in the blockchain and cryptocurrency industry Comprehensive health, dental and vision benefits. 401k matching program Join Spearbit and help us build the future of code security!

OSTP Software DeveloperClifton Park, New YorkTechnical ‚Äì Software Solutions /Full Time /On-siteApply for this jobTeam Description:Kitware‚Äôs Open Source Software Technology Program (OSTP) seeks to recruit hard-working, talented, and curious new graduates with Computer Science and Computer Engineering bachelor‚Äôs degrees to work on exciting open-source projects at Kitware while earning a master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science. The OSTP is a three-year program in which members will work on a variety of projects, learn open-source processes, and build technical leadership skills while completing the master‚Äôs degree. About the Projects:The program allows bachelor-level graduates to gain valuable real-world expertise in open-source software development and earn a master‚Äôs degree while earning a competitive salary. Members of the OSTP will learn to develop innovative open-source software platforms with global impact in the areas of computer vision, scientific computing, data and analytics, medical computing, and software solutions. The OSTP requires both work and study over the three-year program period; program members must work 32 hours per week onsite at our Clifton Park, NY office during college semesters and approximately 40 hours per week on-site during summers. Subject to our tuition reimbursement payback requirements, Kitware will reimburse 100% of educational expenses for the master‚Äôs degree (including tuition, books, equipment, fees, and supplies). This position is only available at our Clifton Park, NY location. Employment Visa sponsorship is not offered for this position.In This Position You Will:Gain a deep understanding of what it takes to create and maintain powerful open-source software platformsLearn the technical and business knowledge to become leaders at KitwareBe taught the fundamentals of project leadership skills and learn how to acquire funding to develop open source platformsGain a Master‚Äôs degreeRequired Qualifications:Completing a bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science or computer engineering in December 2025. (Spring 2025 and Spring 2026 graduates will be considered.)Demonstrable programming experience from undergraduate projects or internshipsProgramming experience in C++ and PythonStrong communication skillsDue to contractual requirements, this position requires US Citizenship and a willingness and ability to obtain and maintain a security clearanceFull-time on-site work at Kitware‚Äôs office in Clifton Park, NYPreferred Qualifications:Existing experience with open source software development is a plus$70,000 - $80,000 a yearCompany Description:Kitware is a research and development software solutions provider with a mission to advance science, make a positive impact, and share our results all within a collaborative, employee-focused work environment that is friendly, fair, and flexible. Our work is improving healthcare outcomes, increasing national security, and advancing our national computing infrastructure. Our customers and collaborators include top universities from around the world, government organizations, national research labs, medical device manufacturers, car manufacturers, financial institutions, and many others. Kitware is proud to be 100% employee-owned, and Great Place to Work-Certified‚Ñ¢. Additional Information:Our team members enjoy a small company environment, flexibility in work assignments, and high levels of independence and responsibility. Besides a great work environment, our comprehensive benefits package includes a competitive compensation plan, tuition reimbursement program, flexible working hours, six weeks paid time off, 401(k), health insurance, life insurance, short- and long-term disability insurance, bonus plan, and free coffee, drinks, and snacks. For more information on our benefit offerings please visit: https://www.kitware.com/careers/.Kitware actively subscribes to a policy of equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, protected veteran status, uniformed service member status, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law. Any unsolicited resume sent to Kitware, including to Kitware's mailing addresses, fax machines or email addresses, whether directly to Kitware employees or to Kitware's applicant tracking system, will be considered Kitware property. Kitware will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume, and will consider any candidate submitted by a recruitment agency without a fully executed contract with Kitware to have been referred free of any charges or fees.If you need assistance with applying or interviewing for a role due to a disability or special need, please reach out directly to our HR team at hr@kitware.com at any time during the hiring process. We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.Apply for this job

ABS currently has openings for its full-time Aspire Rotational Digital Engineer Program, which launches July 2026. This program offers recent university graduates the opportunity to accelerate their career growth through a structured framework that combines challenging work rotations with technical and professional training for a period of up to 12 months. The goal of the rotational program is to develop our next generation of ABS professionals.

Government Contracts StrategistWashington, D.C.Government ‚Äì Legal /Full-time /On-siteApply for this jobAbout the RoleNominal is hiring for a Government Contracts (GoCo) Strategy lead focused on U.S. Government (USG) contracts and large prime partnerships. This role sits at the intersection of Legal, Security, and Business Development and goes beyond shepherding contracts to execution. It is about designing the contracting, pricing, and partnership pathways that shape the future of our government and large prime business. You will own USG contracting architecture end-to-end: from translating early customer interest into acquisition-ready structures, to developing scalable contracting strategies (CSOs, OTAs, IDIQs, GSA schedules), to shaping SaaS pricing approaches that balance regulatory realities (FAR/DFARS) with commercial fundamentals. Beyond individual deals, you will codify institutional knowledge by building repeatable playbooks for USG contracting, industrial security, teaming with primes, and structuring commercial partnerships that strategically advance Nominal‚Äôs growth. This is a high-impact role designed for someone who has operated inside government acquisitions and in the commercial SaaS or government-tech ecosystem, and who can immediately deliver value while laying the foundations for how Nominal scales its USG and large prime business.What You Will DoArchitect U.S. Government and Large Prime DealsOwn end-to-end structuring of complex USG and large prime commercial deals from pre-solicitation shaping to executionTranslate commercial SaaS models into government-aligned pricing and licensing strategiesProactively generate contracting strategies across OTAs, CSOs, IDIQs, GSA schedules, multiple-award vehicles, teaming agreements, and value-added resellersDefine and evolve Nominal‚Äôs USG pricing strategy, balancing contract risk, delivery realities, and commercial growthBuild and Maintain the PlaybookLead development of Nominal‚Äôs USG contracting playbook, including preferred terms, fallback positions, and negotiation strategies for FAR, DFARS, teaming agreements, and subcontractsEnsure repeatability by codifying clause reviews and standard negotiation guidance, reducing reliance on ad hoc expertisePartner with Legal and BD leadership to establish templates and scalable contracting frameworksKO Success and Customer InterfaceServe as our ‚ÄúContracting Officer (KO) Success‚Äù lead, acting as the translation layer between Nominal teams and government KOs, KORs, and other acquisition leadsBuild trusted relationships with acquisition counterparts, ensuring Nominal is positioned for renewals and expansionsPartner with proposal teams to shape white papers, pricing models, and deal structures before formal submissionsIndustrial SecurityServe as Facility Security Officer (FSO), overseeing maturation of Nominal‚Äôs industrial security programManage compliance programs and interface with the USG on security and classification requirementsWork with Legal to shape relevant areas of employee compliance trainingStrategic Partnerships (with large primes and resellers)Lead contracting strategy and success for large prime and reseller partnerships across both our USG and commercial businessDevelop strategies for leveraging value-added resellers and large resellers to expand Nominal‚Äôs routes to marketSupport teaming agreements and prime contracts to ensure Nominal‚Äôs success in joint pursuitsAbout YouCross-functional strategist who thrives at the intersection of legal nuance, government contracting, and commercial creativityDeep experience with USG procurement mechanisms and SaaS or commercial contract structuresDirect experience as a contracting officer or in a comparable acquisition leadership role is requiredPrior experience at an emerging or growth-stage startup is strongly preferredComfortable in ambiguity, with a bias to action and pride in shaping first-of-their-kind deals and frameworksSkilled at cultivating durable relationships with contracting officers, acquisition leads, and prime partnersClear, precise communicator able to adapt across stakeholders including senior government and large prime acquisition executivesQualifications7 to 10+ years of experience spanning federal contracting, acquisitions, deal strategy, or high-stakes commercial negotiationsPrior experience inside a USG acquisition shop and at a commercial defense-tech or SaaS company strongly preferredDirect experience as a KO or comparable USG acquisitions lead requiredActive TS/SCI eligible clearance requiredDeep knowledge of FAR, DFARS, OTAs, GSA, IDIQs, subcontracting under large primes, and related procurement mechanismsProven ability to translate SaaS pricing models into government-compliant strategiesNominal is scaling its USG and large prime partnerships during a critical growth phase. Winning here is not about checking RFP boxes. It is about shaping opportunities, setting precedents, and codifying contracting strategies that compound over time. By leading Deal Strategy for USG and Large Prime Partnerships, you will not only close critical deals but also build the frameworks, playbooks, and security infrastructure that enable Nominal to scale with rigor and confidence. If you thrive on complexity, impact, and shaping how innovative technology companies succeed in the USG and large enterprise market, this role is for you.We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. title: Government Contracts Strategist
description:
About the Role

Nominal is hiring for a Government Contracts (GoCo) Strategy lead focused on U.S. Government (USG) contracts and large prime partnerships. This role sits at the intersection of Legal, Security, and Business Development and goes beyond shepherding contracts to execution. It is about designing the contracting, pricing, and partnership pathways that shape the future of our government and large prime business. You will own USG contracting architecture end-to-end: from translating early customer interest into acquisition-ready structures, to developing scalable contracting strategies (CSOs, OTAs, IDIQs, GSA schedules), to shaping SaaS pricing approaches that balance regulatory realities (FAR/DFARS) with commercial fundamentals. Beyond individual deals, you will codify institutional knowledge by building repeatable playbooks for USG contracting, industrial security, teaming with primes, and structuring commercial partnerships that strategically advance Nominal‚Äôs growth. This is a high-impact role designed for someone who has operated inside government acquisitions and in the commercial SaaS or government-tech ecosystem, and who can immediately deliver value while laying the foundations for how Nominal scales its USG and large prime business.

job_description: üöÄ Join the Future of Commerce with Whatnot! Whatnot is the largest live shopping platform in North America and Europe to buy, sell, and discover the things you love. We‚Äôre re-defining e-commerce by blending community, shopping, and entertainment into a community just for you. As a remote co-located team, we‚Äôre inspired by innovation and anchored in our values . With hubs in the US, UK, Germany, Ireland, and Poland, we‚Äôre building the future of online marketplaces ‚Äìtogether. From fashion, beauty, and electronics to collectibles like trading cards, comic books, and even live plants, our live auctions have something for everyone. And we‚Äôre just getting started! As one of the fastest growing marketplaces , we‚Äôre looking for bold, forward-thinking problem solvers across all functional areas. Check out the latest Whatnot updates on our news and engineering blogs and join us as we enable anyone to turn their passion into a business, and bring people together through commerce. üíª Role We are looking for intellectually curious, highly motivated individuals to join us post grad in 2026. The most important skills you‚Äôll need to have are making sound product decisions and shipping high-quality products fast. We look for engineers with great product instincts who can own whole projects from start to finish. The engineering team operates with a high level of autonomy so we need to hire people we can trust. Your ability to make good trade-offs and exercise good judgment is essential to us. Some job duties include: Building new features for users in our live-streams Implementing growth tactics and strategies to scale our buyer and seller flows Building systems at scale that help us deliver a high trust marketplace experience Writing product or system development code Designing, implementing, and operating our most critical and scalable services Carefully evaluating the technical tradeoffs of every decision Supporting features at every phase, from design through implementation and launch Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues, network, or service operations and quality. We offer flexibility to work from home or from one of our global office hubs, and we value in-person time for planning, problem-solving, and connection. Team members in this role must live within commuting distance of our San Francisco, Los Angeles, Seattle or New York City hub. üëã You Curious about who thrives at Whatnot? We‚Äôve found that embodying a low ego, growth mindset, and high-impact drive goes a long way here. As our next Engineer you should have some industry software engineering experience, plus: Graduating with a CS or Software Engineering degree in Dec 2025 or by Summer 2026 Problem solver and out-of-the-box thinker Willing to take risks and build product and systems for 1M+ users Capable of building scalable systems Excellent product instincts. You first think about users rather than the best technical solution You are known for shipping products and features lightning-fast Ability to pick up on new technologies very quickly Open to relocation to New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, or Seattle üéÅ Benefits Generous Holiday and Time off Policy Health Insurance options including Medical, Dental, Vision Work From Home Support Home office setup allowance Monthly allowance for cell phone and internet Care benefits Monthly allowance for wellness Annual allowance towards Childcare Lifetime benefit for family planning, such as adoption or fertility expenses Retirement; 401k offering for Traditional and Roth accounts in the US (employer match up to 4% of base salary) and Pension plans internationally Monthly allowance to dogfood the app All Whatnauts are expected to develop a deep understanding of our product. We're passionate about building the best user experience, and all employees are expected to use Whatnot as both a buyer and a seller as part of their job (our dogfooding budget makes this fun and easy!). Parental Leave 16 weeks of paid parental leave + one month gradual return to work *company leave allowances run concurrently with country leave requirements which take precedence. üíõ EOE Whatnot is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, parental status, disability status, or any other status protected by local law. We believe that our work is better and our company culture is improved when we encourage, support, and respect the different skills and experiences represented within our workforce.

OffDeal is the world‚Äôs first AI-native investment bank for small businesses. Instead of selling AI to Goldman Sachs, we‚Äôre building what Goldman itself would have looked like if it launched in 2025. Wall Street's playbook works well, but only for billion-dollar deals - it breaks where most businesses actually exist. Traditional firms run oversized teams on outdated software, making smaller M&A transactions uneconomical. This leaves millions of small business owners with nowhere to turn for the most important sale of their lives‚Ä¶ Until now. Our engineers built software to automate 80%+ of analyst work with AI, so our in-house bankers can focus where it counts - on earning owners‚Äô trust and closing deals. We recently closed a $12M Series A ($17M in total funding) from Radical Ventures and Y Combinator and are scaling really fast. In less than a year, our team has already launched over 30 sell-side M&A transactions and has delivered numerous life-changing exits to our clients - and we‚Äôre just getting started. Read more about our story: https://www.ft.com/content/9daf5c7e-e301-4b7d-809a-ff9fb336bdbc https://www.cnbc.com/video/2025/08/04/wall-streets-new-ai-era-offdeal-ceo-on-using-ai-to-disrupt-investment-banking.html https://www.fullydistributed.co/p/the-bull-case-for-an-ai-native-investment The Role As a Full Stack Engineer, you'll work directly with the CTO and the investment banking team to build the AI-native platform that empowers our investment bankers to be 10x more productive. Your work will directly impact how $10 trillion worth of small businesses change hands over the coming decade. What You'll Do Collaborate with our in-house investment bankers to own 0 to 1 projects, from ideation to deployment Build across the entire stack, in our 100% TypeScript (i.e. ReactJS + NodeJS) codebase Work with the latest AI tech, from on our in-house AI agents to complex recommendation and search algorithms We‚Äôre Looking for Someone Who Has / Is a‚Ä¶ Proficiency in TypeScript, React, and Node.js with experience building full-stack applications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related technical field Previous software engineering experience through internships, co-ops, or professional roles Comfort in ambiguous and unstructured startup work environments Willingness to work in-person at our NYC office, 5 days a week Why Join OffDeal We only hire best-in-class engineers, and are offering compensation to reflect it Top-tier benefits, including medical, dental, vision, and unlimited PTO Perks like free food, Equinox membership, and NYC relocation allowance Work with bleeding edge AI on a modern codebase Opportunity to be a foundational team member at a well-funded, high-growth startup Be part of a mission to shape the future of small business ownership and to promote American entrepreneurship
